metadata.subject: A polite interview: "Skin So Thin, It's Inside Out" - Ethan Persoff talks with Paul Krassner

relationships.description: Paul Krassner founded and edited The Realist magazine
Discussion of Trump's relationship with Russia and Putin
Trump's attacks on media as 'fake news'
Krassner and Bruce were colleagues and friends in comedy

transactions: Trump buying 20,000 copies of his own book
Church of Scientology manipulating bestseller lists

analysis.purpose: To discuss Paul Krassner's perspectives on Donald Trump's presidency, media manipulation, and historical context from his career in satire
analysis.significance: Provides historical perspective on current political events from a veteran satirist and counterculture figure

notable_quotes: "Trump is a true, extraordinary liar. Everything he says about anybody is really about him."
"Trump has skin so thin, it's inside out. That's what he was doing during the campaign - if your skin is inside out, then it's projecting."
"Trump is essentially the monster we've created. Whereas Frankenstein was made from corpses, Trump was made from fringe subcultures."
red_flags: References to blackmail in political contexts (J. Edgar Hoover example)
Historical manipulation of media and bestseller lists

evidence: Mentions J. Edgar Hoover using blackmail tactics with JFK photos, but only as historical example
blackmail_indicators.description: No direct blackmail or coercion discussed in current context - only historical references to past political tactics

illegal_activity.description: No first-hand illegal activity discussed - only historical references to past events and political commentary

details: References to New York Times bestseller list hacking

public_knowledge.context: This interview discusses well-known political figures and historical events that have been extensively covered in media

analysis.summary: This is an interview between Ethan Persoff and Paul Krassner discussing Donald Trump's presidency through the lens of historical satire and media manipulation, with Krassner providing perspective from his decades of experience in counterculture journalism and comedy.
